message_1: Identify the atomic number, mass number, and number of neutrons in the isotope of uranium-235.
message_2:
The isotope of uranium-235 is represented as U-235.

Atomic number (Z): The atomic number represents the number of protons in an element. Uranium has an atomic number of 92, which means it has 92 protons.

Mass number (A): The mass number represents the total number of protons and neutrons in an isotope. For uranium-235, the mass number is 235.

Number of neutrons (N): To find the number of neutrons in the isotope, subtract the atomic number from the mass number. 

Number of neutrons (N) = Mass number (A) - Atomic number (Z)
N = 235 - 92
N = 143

So, uranium-235 has an atomic number of 92, a mass number of 235, and 143 neutrons.
